task.title: Write user documentation
task.description:
## Context
Write user-facing documentation for Toolsmith: usage guide, command reference, troubleshooting.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** haiku
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Add section to README.md or create dedicated docs file.

## Implementation Steps
1. Decide on location: section in README.md vs separate docs/toolsmith.md
2. Write overview: what Toolsmith does, when to use it
3. Write command reference: sync, search, stats with examples
4. Write configuration section (if any config options)
5. Write troubleshooting section (common errors, solutions)
6. Add examples with realistic queries

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Documentation explains Toolsmith purpose
- [ ] All CLI commands documented with examples
- [ ] Common use cases covered
- [ ] Troubleshooting section addresses likely issues
- [ ] Examples use realistic queries and show expected output
- [ ] Documentation is discoverable from main README

## Files Likely Involved
- `README.md` (modify) or `docs/toolsmith.md` (new)
- `CLAUDE.md` (add Toolsmith notes if relevant)

## Notes
- Keep documentation concise and practical
- Include actual command output examples
- Link to source documentation for each source
- Consider adding to `cub toolsmith --help` with longer descriptions
